User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64) AppleWebKit/535.1 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/14.0.835.202 Safari/535.1

Steps to reproduce:

1) Add a newsserver account. 
2) Set a filter which is (almost) always successful (I used FROM contains '.' or FROM contains'@'), and yes, I did make sure that the filter was activated if either condition was true. The filter action is to copy the messages to a folder under Local Folders. 
3) Subscribe to a newsgroup, set filter logging on. 
4) Download new messages in the newsgroup. 
5) Check the filter log. 


Actual results:

The filter log shows that the filter condition was satisfied and claims that the messages were copied, but nothing appears in the folder to which they should have been copied. 


Expected results:

Self-evidently, the messages SHOULD have been copied, otherwise it makes no sense to allow the user to set a filter to do this. 

As a further quirk, if you subsequently open the filter dialog, and run the exact same filter manually on the downloaded newsgroup, it works, the messages are copied.
